TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
37 [Vita sancti Nicholai]
SE&ydot;nt Nicholas þe holie Man man &punctelev; þat guod confessour was
Of heiȝe men he was icome &punctelev; In þe cite of patras Patras
Fo&rrot; in patras Patras he was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; nelle ich þarof nouȝt l&ydot;e
his moder name was Ione &punctelev; his faderes epiphanie Epiphanie
Þe fur&slong;te da&ydot; þat he was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; þat child þat was so guod
Ase it was in ane mele ibaþed &punctelev; al one up&rrot;iȝt it &slong;tod
Ano[n] so he was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; he[MS. and] gan to beo guod and clene
he nolde fridai ne wodnesda&ydot; WodnesdayEpiphanie &punctelev; souke nouȝt bote ene
Þo he couþe gon ant speke &punctelev; he ne pleide neuere mo
Ake ȝwane oþur child&rrot;en rageden[o&rrot;ig. raieden] fa&slong;te &punctelev; to churche he wolde go
he nolde speke non &ydot;del wo&rrot;d &punctelev; ase swuche child&rrot;en doth
Leiȝingue and pleiȝes and ragingues &punctelev; he bilefte also
Þo he was sethþe of gretto&rrot;e elde &punctelev; to scole he was iset
So wel he leo&rrot;nede &punctelev; þat man nu&slong;te no child leo&rrot;ni bet
Sethþe þo he mo&rrot;e couþe &punctelev; al his &slong;tudie he tok
to guodespelles ant to holi writes &punctelev; and alle oþere bokes fo&rrot;sok
So clene lijf he ladde ȝong &punctelev; þat deinte it was to wite
Mo&rrot;e godnesse ne miȝte beo &punctelev; þane we findeth of him iwrite
Þo is fader and is moder weren dede &punctelev; þis holie child Nicholas
lu&ydot;te tolde of heo&rrot;e guode &punctelev; þei he heo&rrot;e e&ydot;r was
to pouere Men men he ȝaf it clene &punctelev; ȝware he saiȝ neode
And heo þat nolden bidde him non &punctelev; &slong;tilleliche he gan hem beode
An heiȝ Man man þare was biside &punctelev; þat sethþe þo&rrot;uȝ luþer cas
his guod was alclene awei igo &punctelev; and al pouere bicome he was
he hadde þre douȝtren faire inouȝ &punctelev; clene and guode also
In so gret Meseise meseise heo weren ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; þat heo nu&slong;ten ȝwat to do
Þo heo nu&slong;ten ȝwarebi libbe &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e guod heom was binome
heo&rrot;e red hu&ydot; nomen alle þreo &punctelev; fole wommen to bicome
And raþer þanne heo in swuche houngur weren &punctelev; to libbe bi ho&rrot;e|[MS. heo&rrot;e] dom
Þe olde man heo&rrot; alre fader &punctelev; gret deol to him he nom
gret pite hadde in is heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þe guode seint Nicholas
Þo he iheo&rrot;de þe deolfole mone &punctelev; þat among heom alle was
Of is fader guode a n&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; ane beiȝ of gold he nam
Iwounde in one cloute &punctelev; and &slong;tilleliche to heo&rrot;e house he cam
to a derne w&ydot;ndouwe softeliche &punctelev; seint Nicholas gan gon
And ca&slong;te in þat gold p&rrot;iueliche &punctelev; and wende aȝein anon
Þis housebonde aros aMo&rrot;uwe amoruwe &punctelev; ant þarof nu&slong;te nouȝt
he com and fond þane beiȝ of gold &punctelev; þat seint Nicholas hadde ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þarof he was glad inouȝ &punctelev; þei he nu&slong;te ho it b&rrot;ouȝte
he it nam and þonkede Iesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þat on is meseise þouȝte
Þarewith he conseilede sw&ydot;þe wel &punctelev; his elde&slong;te douȝter sone
With fair b&rrot;u&ydot;dale and gret honour &punctelev; ase riȝt was fo&rrot;to done
Seint Nicholas isaiȝ al þis &punctelev; and naþeles ȝu&ydot;t he þouȝte
Þat þis selie Man man neode hadde &punctelev; þat he mo&rrot;e guod to him b&rrot;ouȝte
A niȝt he awaitede sw&ydot;þe wel &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd it wolde
And at one fene&slong;tre ca&slong;te In eftsone &punctelev; ane oþur beiȝ of golde
Þis housebonde amo&rrot;ewe aros &punctelev; þat gold he fond sone
he þonkede god God with guode heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þat hadde iheo&rrot;d is bone
And natheles him wond&rrot;ede muche &punctelev; ho is freond so wel were
And þouȝte þat he awaiti wolde &punctelev; ȝif he mo&rrot;e come þere
he conseilede is oþur douȝter &punctelev; swiþe wel with þis golde
With gret nobleie and fa&ydot;r b&rrot;u&ydot;dale &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd it wolde
Ȝeot þouȝte þis guode Nicholas &punctelev; þo þis was al ido
Þat it were guod to conseili &punctelev; þe þridde douȝter also
A niȝt he wende wel &slong;tilledliche &punctelev; to þat fene&slong;tre eftsone
And ca&slong;te In ane beiȝ of gold &punctelev; ase he was iwoned to done
Þis housebonde hadde iwaked longue &punctelev; fo&rrot;to wa&ydot;ti of þis cas
So þat þo seint Nicholas cam &punctelev; wakiende he was
Op he &slong;turte and siwede him &punctelev; and bi is cloþus heold him fa&slong;te
he ne let nouȝt go are þe guode man &punctelev; ikneuȝ him at þe la&slong;te
Ȝeo&rrot;ne bad seint Nicholas &punctelev; þat he to no man ne sede
Þe ȝw&ydot;le þat he aliue were &punctelev; of þis p&rrot;iue dede
With þis gold þe þridde douȝter &punctelev; wel iconseilled was
And alle þreo weren riche[al. gode] wiues &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ seint Nicholas
In þis manere seint Nicholas &punctelev; ase ich nouþe habbe ised
Delde al is heritage &punctelev; þo is fader was ded
Ȝwane oþur Men men eoden to habbe solas &punctelev; he nadde þarto no[MS. ne] wille
to churche he wolde and in one hu&ydot;rne &punctelev; is beden bidde wel &slong;tille
¶ Hit bifeol þat þe bischop &punctelev; of Mirre was ded
And folk cam to cheose ane oþur &punctelev; and þarof h&ydot; nomen heo&rrot;e red
So þat heo weren in ho&rrot;e beden &punctelev; n&ydot;ȝt and dai wel fa&slong;te
Þat o&rrot;e louerd heom sende ane guode man &punctelev; and he herde heom ate la&slong;te
Fo&rrot; a n&ydot;ȝt þare cam a voiz &punctelev; ase it were in metingue
to a bischop þat was mai&slong;ter þer &punctelev; and tolde him þis t&ydot;þingue[al. of þe cheosinge]
And seide goth tomo&rrot;ewe to churche[to ch. on the margin.] sone &punctelev; riȝt are hit dai beo
Þe fur&slong;te man þat ȝe þare mouwen &punctelev; iheo&rrot;e oþur iseo
And þat hote Nicholas &punctelev; takez him wel sone
And makez him bischop of Mirre &punctelev; god God hath iheo&rrot;d ower bone
þe bischop and þat oþur folk &punctelev; arisen are hit dai were
And comen to churche and founden sone &punctelev; Nicholas &slong;tonde þere
In one hu&ydot;rne he &slong;tod ful &slong;tille &punctelev; heo axeden ȝwat he was
And ȝwat were is riȝte name &punctelev; he seide hem Nicholas
heo nomen and ladden him with gret honour &punctelev; to þe churche of Mirree
And sacreden him to bischop þere &punctelev; and setten him in is se
Þo he was heiȝ man imaked &punctelev; þis guode Nicholas
Mo&rrot;e bouȝsum and milde he bicam &punctelev; þane euer er [he] was
lu&ydot;te p&rrot;u&ydot;te he hadde of is power &punctelev; ȝwane men him wolden aloute
And ȝif it nere fo&rrot; eiȝe of god God &punctelev; leouere him were withoute
So p&rrot;e&slong;t he was to alle men &punctelev; þat on him beden & cride
And so muche fo&rrot; heom he dude &punctelev; þat men speken þarof wide
Muche folk In a time &punctelev; Into þe se iwende
In a schip to don heo&rrot;e neode &punctelev; ȝif o&rrot;e louerd þe grace heom sende
So þat þere cam a gret tempe&slong;te &punctelev; þat heo wenden alle ad&rrot;enche
Alle guodnesse heo biheiȝten god God &punctelev; þat heo miȝten on biþenche
So þat heo þouȝten ase heo&rrot;e schip &punctelev; toward þe grounde was
On þe guodnesse þat men tolden &punctelev; of þe bischop Nicholas
Leoue louerd Nicholas" &punctelev; wel loude alle heo criden
Ȝif it is[MS. it] soth þat we habbez &punctelev; iheo&rrot;d tellen of þe wide
In þis peril saue us nouþe &punctelev; þat we ne beon ad&rrot;eint
Louerd Nicholas help us nouþe &punctelev; are o&rrot;e schip beo aseint
Ase heo gradden þare cam on eo&rrot;ne &punctelev; onowarde þe watere biside
A bischop in abite swiþe fair &punctelev; wel loude on him hu&ydot; cride
Lo me here" quath þis holie man &punctelev; ȝe cleopeden me wel fa&slong;te
Seggez ȝwat ouwer wille beo &punctelev; and ȝwarof ȝe beon aga&slong;te
Louerd heo seiden Nicholas &punctelev; ȝif it is þi wille
Saue us nouþe of þis tempe&slong;te &punctelev; þat we he[re][MS. he] ne aspille
Ne habbe ȝe quath þis holie man &punctelev; herof none d&rrot;ede
Þat weder bicam þo &slong;tille inouȝ &punctelev; þo he þeos wo&rrot;des sede
heo biheolden þo after him &punctelev; heo nu&slong;ten ȝware he was
And þonkeden muche o&rrot;e swete louerd &punctelev; and þene bischop Nicholas
Þene wei &slong;tille and murie &punctelev; toward þe londe hu&ydot; nome
Withoute eche de&slong;tourbingue &punctelev; to londe wel glade heo come
Alle heo duden heom fo&rrot;t anon &punctelev; to þe bischope Nicholas
Ase to a man þat heo neuere ne seiȝen &punctelev; ne nu&slong;ten ȝwuch he was
Ech of heom biheolden him fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat to þis guode man com
Alle heom þouȝte þat it was he &punctelev; þat þene deth heom binam
Louerd heo seiden ihered þou beo &punctelev; to þe we gradden bliue
Onouewarde þe se þo þou come &punctelev; and b&rrot;ouȝte&slong;t us to liue
Ihered beo þe t&ydot;me þat þou mo&slong;t &punctelev; among men on eo&rrot;þe beo
Fo&rrot; swuche grace ne hadde neuere eo&rrot;þelich Man man &punctelev; ase man ma&ydot; on þe ise
Þis guode Man man þo he iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; þonkede and herede also
Ore louerd þat wolde fo&rrot; is loue &punctelev; su&ydot;ch miracle do
¶ hit bifeol In ane oþur t&ydot;me &punctelev; of þe bischop Nicholas
Þat gret hongur alaboute &punctelev; In is bischop&rrot;iche was
So luþere fullen þe ȝeres alle &punctelev; þat no co&rrot;n nouȝwere nas
gret deol hadde þis guode bischop &punctelev; of þat luþere cas
Fram feo&rrot;rene contreies[al. om.] þare comen schipes &punctelev; with muche co&rrot;n þare|biside
Þis bischop wende aȝein heom sone &punctelev; and bad heom one &slong;tounde abide
Fo&rrot; þe loue of Iesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; leneth me he sede
Ane hond&rrot;et quarters of þat co&rrot;n &punctelev; þat ȝe þare doth lede
to þis selie men þat beoth here &punctelev; neiȝ fo&rrot; houngur dede
heo ne habbeth no co&rrot;n to libbe bi &punctelev; to sede ne to b&rrot;ede
Certes sire þis schipmen seiden &punctelev; þat ne do&rrot;re we nouȝt
Fo&rrot; al þis co&rrot;n þat þou isixt &punctelev; þat we habbez here ib&rrot;ouȝt
With sw&ydot;þe schars met withalle &punctelev; bitauȝt it is us echone
Þat we it leden þe Aumperour &punctelev; ne do&rrot;re we make no lone
Withoute faille quath þis gode man &punctelev; ne d&rrot;edez ou riȝt nouȝt
Ȝif ȝe me wollez þarof lene &punctelev; þat eov schulle faili ouȝt
Þe folle ȝe schulle ȝelden þe Aumperoure &punctelev; ase men token ou fo&rrot;to lede
Noþing ne schal ou failli &punctelev; ne þarf ov noþing d&rrot;ede
Þe schipmen ope tru&slong;te of is wo&rrot;d &punctelev; wel largeliche him mete
And token þe bischope wel imetene &punctelev; Ane hound&rrot;ed quarteres ȝwete
And wenden fo&rrot;th to þe Aumperour &punctelev; and is co&rrot;n him ladde
And beden is &slong;tiwardes meten wel &punctelev; ȝif heo þe folle hadden
hu&ydot; meten and founden al þe fulle &punctelev; and wel mo&rrot;e þareto
Fo&rrot; wonder heo axeden þe schipmen &punctelev; ȝwi it woxe so
heo þonkeden anon þane gode bischop &punctelev; þat is neode to heom mende
And tolden fo&rrot;e þe Aumperoure &punctelev; hou muche co&rrot;n heo him lende
And hou he bihet heom þat it ne scholde &punctelev; þarefo&rrot;e ne wanie nouȝt
And hou heo hadden bi large met &punctelev; wel mo&rrot;e co&rrot;n ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þis guode bischope heo hereden swiþe &punctelev; and þonkeden muche also
Þat hadde þo&rrot;u o&rrot;e louerdes grace &punctelev; swche miracle ido
Al þe contreie hadde inouȝ &punctelev; to mete and to sede
To ȝer and mo&rrot;e of þat co&rrot;n &punctelev; þat heo gonne þare lede
¶ In an oþur t&ydot;me þis guode bischop &punctelev; bi a fair treo com
he fond þare men þat duden þing &punctelev; aȝein heo&rrot;e cri&slong;tinedom
heo &slong;toden þare ase heo ofte duden &punctelev; and maden heo&rrot;e sacrefise
to þe deuel onder þis treo &punctelev; þat men[superscribed.] miȝten þarof agrise
Seint Nicholas heom to&rrot;nede echone &punctelev; gode men fo&rrot;to be
And dude heom fo&rrot;sake þe feondes lo&rrot;e &punctelev; and hewe adoun þat treo
Þe deuel after þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; to him hadde gret onde
Fo&rrot;to abatien is pouwer &punctelev; in alle manere he gan fonde
pilegrimes weren in þe se &punctelev; to seint Nicholas fo&rrot;to wende
Fo&rrot; þe guodnesse þat hu&ydot; of him herden &punctelev; ȝif god God heom wolde þe grace sende
In fourme of a fair womman &punctelev; þe deuel cam heom to
And seide louerdingues wel is eou &punctelev; þat ȝe mouwen ouwer wille do
Fo&rrot;to seche þis holie man &punctelev; þat so milsful is and hende
Leouere ich hadde þane aniþing &punctelev; miȝte ich with ou wende
Fo&rrot; ich ne wilni noþing so muche &punctelev; ase þane holie man to seo
A lu&ydot;te þing ȝe moten fo&rrot; me don &punctelev; ȝwane it ne ma&ydot; oþur beo
Nimeth here þis guode o&ydot;gnement &punctelev; þat deo&rrot;ewurþe is withalle
And ȝwane ȝe into is churche comiet &punctelev; smeo&rrot;ieth in eche walle
Fo&rrot;to wurthschipien þane guode man &punctelev; þat is of so gret pou&slong;te
And ȝwane ich ne mai to him come &punctelev; doth þat In þe mu&ydot;nde of me
Þis pilegrimes with glade heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þis o&ydot;nement to heom nome
to smerien with þis holie churche &punctelev; ȝwane heo þudere come
Ase he wenden fo&rrot;th in þe se &punctelev; sone it dude bifalle
Þat þare cam to heom a schip &punctelev; with faire men withalle
A bischop þare was among heom &punctelev; swiþe fair man and hende
he grette heom faire and axede anon &punctelev; ȝwodere heo þouȝten wende
heo seiden þat heo wolden &punctelev; ȝif it gode&slong; Godes wille were
to þe churche of Mirree &punctelev; fo&rrot;to Anouri seint Nicholas þere
Ȝwat was þe womman þe bischop seide &punctelev; þat ȝwile er eou cam to
And ȝwat was it þat heo eou biteiȝte &punctelev; ȝwat schulle ȝe þarewith do
Sire it is an o&ydot;nement &punctelev; þeos pilegrimes seden
Þe guode womman ȝeo&rrot;ne us bad &punctelev; to þe holie churche it lede
And þarewith in mu&ydot;nde of hire &punctelev; ȝwane it were þudere ib&rrot;ouȝt
Smeo&rrot;ie þe holie churche wowes &punctelev; þat we ne leten it nouȝt
Ȝe ȝe quath þis holie man &punctelev; ȝe nuten nouȝt ȝwat heo is
takez me þat o&ydot;nement &punctelev; and ȝe schullen iseo iwis
Þis guode man nam þat o&ydot;nement &punctelev; and amidde þe se it ca&slong;te
Þat watur bigan to berne anon &punctelev; aȝein is ku&ydot;nde wel fa&slong;te
Fram &slong;tude to &slong;tude þat fu&ydot;r o&rrot;n &punctelev; and barnde þe se iwis
Þo seide þe guode man here ȝe iseoth &punctelev; ȝwat ouwer o&ydot;nement is
hadde ȝe aniþing þarof &punctelev; on þe churchewalles ido
Al þe churche hadde fo&rrot;barnd &punctelev; and al þe toun also
hit was þe foule feond of helle &punctelev; þat it ou tok with honde
Fo&rrot;to b&rrot;enne þulke churche &punctelev; fo&rrot; he haueth þarto onde
Fo&rrot;th wende þis bischop and alle his &punctelev; anonriȝt þo&rrot;uȝ gode&slong; Godes sonde
Þe pilegrimes roweden[o&rrot;ig. rewe] þene nexte we&ydot; &punctelev; so þat hu&ydot; comen to londe
to seint Nicholas heo wenden þo &punctelev; þat heo so wide souȝte
Anon so heo iseiȝen þis guode man &punctelev; heo &slong;toden in grete þouȝte
heom þouȝte þat it þe bischop was &punctelev; þat in þe se to heom cam
Þat schewude hem þat o&ydot;nement &punctelev; and þe feondes sw&ydot;kedam
Louerd heo seiden nov þin o&rrot;e &punctelev; muche is þi pouwer
Þat we iseiȝen in þe se &punctelev; are we comen her
heo hereden muche þene holie man &punctelev; as it wel riȝt was
Þe guode man fa&slong;te heom fo&rrot;bed &punctelev; þat heo ne tolden nouȝt þis cas
Fairo&rrot;e Miracle on eo&rrot;þe &punctelev; ne miȝte we neuere iwite
Þane we of seint Nicholas &punctelev; findeth ofte iwrite
In a t&ydot;me luþere men weo&rrot;reden &punctelev; þene Aumperour of rome
And de&slong;tru&ydot;den is londes fa&slong;te &punctelev; and bataille aȝein him nome
Þe Aumperour nam þre grete louerdingues &punctelev; and oþere wel mani on
Fo&rrot;to wenden Iarmede iarmed sw&ydot;þe wel &punctelev; to fiȝten aȝein is fon
Þis þreo p&rrot;inces with heo&rrot;e men &punctelev; in þe se fo&rrot;th iwenden
to fiȝten aȝein is w&ydot;þerw&ydot;nes &punctelev; ase þe Aumperour heom sende
So þat þe w&ydot;nd heom d&rrot;of &punctelev; ase it were bi cas
to þe contreie of Mirree &punctelev; þare þis bischop was
Þe bischop heo&rrot;de of hem telle &punctelev; aȝen heom he wende sone
And bad heom come and ete with him &punctelev; and hu&ydot; graunteden is bone
Þis [þe][om.] guode man dude fo&rrot; heo ne scholden &punctelev; none robberie do
he made hem su&ydot;þe wel an a&ydot;se &punctelev; and fair semblaunt also
So þat þo&rrot;uȝ þis holie bischop &punctelev; heo and heo&rrot;e fon
Withoute dunt oþur blod isched &punctelev; aco&rrot;ded[o&rrot;ig. aco&rrot;det] weren anon
Alto þe Aumpero&rrot;es guode &punctelev; ant to his honour also
Þeos þre mai&slong;tres wenden hamward &punctelev; þo þis dede was ido
heo comen and tolden þe Aumperour &punctelev; hov heo hadden on itake
Þe Aumperour was wel apa&ydot;d &punctelev; and gret fe&slong;te gan heom make
heo&rrot;e luþere felawes comen sone &punctelev; and þareto hadden envie
And seiden heo hadden þe Aumperoure &punctelev; idon gret tricherie
And with is fon imaked a fol pa&ydot;s &punctelev; and with grete feolonie
to þe deseritisun of þe Aumperour &punctelev; ope heom heo gunne l&ydot;e
Þe Aumperour in grete wrathþe &punctelev; let heom nime fa&slong;te
And binden þeos þre p&rrot;inces &punctelev; and in &slong;trongue p&rrot;isone ca&slong;te
So fa&slong;te weren þis luþere men &punctelev; ope þis p&rrot;inces þreo
Þat þe Aumperour swo&rrot; is oth &punctelev; Aslawe heo scholden beo
he let somon&ydot; is kn&ydot;ȝtes alle &punctelev; þat heo amo&rrot;ewe come
Fo&rrot;to b&rrot;inguen þeos þreo p&rrot;inces &punctelev; to deþe þo&rrot;uȝ heo&rrot;e dome
Anon so þe tiþingue was ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; to þis p&rrot;inces[al. p&rrot;isons] þreo
heo weopen and criden deolfulliche &punctelev; þat reuþe it was to se
heo weopen and heo&rrot;e cloþes teren &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e her also
And þouȝten on þe grete godnesse &punctelev; þat seint Nicholas hadde ido.[vv. 2412 al. om.]
Louerd heo seiden Nicholas &punctelev; fro ȝwam wel glade we eode
And also wis ase we gultelese beoth &punctelev; help us in o&rrot;e neode
Ne lat us neuere þus gultelese &punctelev; to deþe beon ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þe holie bischop Nicholas &punctelev; ne furȝat heom nouȝt &punctelev; [vv. 2456 al. om.]
Fo&rrot; a n&ydot;ȝt ase þe Aumperour &punctelev; ase a louerd la&ydot; and ase a sire
Into is paleis þat was so &slong;trong &punctelev; and ibarred al with ire
to him riȝt bifo&rrot;e his bed &punctelev; þis holi bischop com[o&rrot;ig. caom]
And seide sire Aumperour ȝwat þenc&slong;t þou &punctelev; with þi false dom
Ȝwi ha&slong;t þou þis gultelese men &punctelev; In þi p&rrot;isone ib&rrot;ouȝt
And gulteles þenche&slong;t heom aquelle &punctelev; ich rede withd&rrot;auȝ þi þouȝt
Aris op sone ich rede þe &punctelev; and lat heom of p&rrot;isone wende
Oþur ichulle mine louerd bidde &punctelev; þat he þe weo&rrot;re sende[al. schal þe schende]
Þat þareinne þou wo&rrot;&slong;t altoboned &punctelev; and ib&rrot;ouȝt of lijfdawe
Þat foules schullen and wilde be&slong;tes &punctelev; þi caro&ydot;ne altod&rrot;awe."[vv. 2556 al. om]
Ȝwat artov quath þe Aumperour &punctelev; oþur of ȝwat pou&slong;te
Þat in þis t&ydot;me art icome &punctelev; into mi pale&ydot;s to me
And swuche bolde wo&rrot;des spext &punctelev; wonder me þinchez of þe
Ich am quath þis Nicholas &punctelev; bischop of mirree
¶ Seint Nicholas wende also &punctelev; to þe Aumperoures heiȝe Iu&slong;tise iustise
Þare he lai biside in þe pale&ydot;s &punctelev; and made him sumdel agrise
Þov witlese wrechche he seide &punctelev; ȝwat haue&slong;tou iþouȝt
Ra&slong;tov þat þis gultelese men &punctelev; to deþe beon ib&rrot;ouȝt
Withd&rrot;auȝ þi red ich þe rede sone &punctelev; oþur þou schalt al fo&rrot;dw&ydot;ne
And fo&rrot;leose al þi guod &punctelev; and de&ydot;ȝe in &slong;trongue pine
Ȝwat artou þis oþur seide &punctelev; þat spext wo&rrot;des þus grete
And þe Aumpero&rrot;es heiȝe Iu&slong;tise &punctelev; þus baldeliche dar&slong;t þrete
Ich am he seide Nicholas &punctelev; bischop of Mirree
bote þou withd&rrot;awe þi red sone &punctelev; þou schalt ileue me
Þe Aumperour lai and quakede so&rrot;e &punctelev; and sende after is Iu&slong;tise iustise
Þat was also so&rrot;e ad&rrot;ad &punctelev; and so&rrot;uful in eche wise
E&ydot;þur tolde oþur fo&rrot;e &punctelev; hou he to heom seide
And wel baldeliche þretnede heom &punctelev; ȝwarefo&rrot;e heo weren in d&rrot;ede
Fo&rrot;to schilden heom fram is wrathþe &punctelev; anoþur heo mo&slong;ten rede
Þis þre p&rrot;isones heo leten up nime &punctelev; and sone bifo&rrot;e heom lede
Swiþe so&rrot;e heo weren ad&rrot;adde &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo wenden anon beo dede
To þe bischop Nicholas &punctelev; reuliche heo gonne grede
beaus amis quath þe Aumperour &punctelev; ȝwatmanere men beo ȝe
Þat þus þo&rrot;uȝ ouwer enchauntement &punctelev; aniȝt d&rrot;echcheth me
A sire merci þis oþure seide &punctelev; ȝwi wolle ȝe seggen so
Of anchauntement ne couþe we neuere &punctelev; ope god God we wollez us do
Ake gultelese men we buth &punctelev; with onriȝte hidere ib&rrot;ouȝt
Also wis god God schilde us fram þe deth &punctelev; ase we ne beth gultie nouȝt
Iknowe ȝe ani Man man quath þe Aumperour &punctelev; þat hote Nicholas
Þare nas neuere on fo&rrot; þis wo&rrot;d &punctelev; þat in gre[t] hope ne was
heo&rrot;e hondene heo heolden op on heiȝ &punctelev; and wel loude gradden
to þe bischope[MS. bi bischope] Nicholas &punctelev; þat he reuþe of heom hadde
Þo&rrot;uȝ him quath þe Aumperour &punctelev; ȝe beth to liue ido
Ich ou ȝiue lijf and lime &punctelev; and ouwer chateles also
goth nouþe ha&slong;teliche to him &punctelev; and tellez him wel bliue
hou þat fo&rrot; þe loue of him &punctelev; ich let ov gon aliue
biddeth þat he fo&rrot;ȝiue me is wrathþe &punctelev; and non harm fo&rrot; eu me do
Ake þat he bidde god God fo&rrot; me &punctelev; and fo&rrot; mi k&ydot;nedom also[vv. 2934 al. om.]
Þis p&rrot;isones wenden with glade heo&rrot;te &punctelev; to þe bischope Nicholas
And þonkeden him ase heo auȝten wel &punctelev; of þis Io&ydot;fule cas
Ich wene þere nas neuere haluwe &punctelev; seint Nicholases iper
Þat so manie faire Miracles &punctelev; bi is liue dude her
Fo&rrot; to come into so &slong;trong paleis &punctelev; and gon opon þe se also
gret wonder was þat anibodi &punctelev; swuch miracle miȝte do
Muche of þe ku&ydot;nde of heuene &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd here him sende
Aungles dede aliue to do &punctelev; are he hennes iwende.[vv. 297302 al. om.]
Þo o&rrot;e louerdes wille was &punctelev; þat he scholde hennes wiende
he bad o&rrot;e louerd þat he scholde &punctelev; aungles to him sende
Þo he isa&ydot; þe Aungles to him come &punctelev; he þonkede o&rrot;e louerd fa&slong;te
Þe þrittiþe saume of þe sauter &punctelev; he bigan þus ate la&slong;te
In þe louerd ich habbe ihoped &punctelev; þat ich iconfundet ne beo
Þine holie ere beiȝ adoun to me &punctelev; heiȝe and deliuere me
he deide ate sixte vers &punctelev; þat on e[n]glichs Englichs to seggen is
Mine soule louerd ich bitake þe &punctelev; þou bouȝte&slong;t hire iwis
Þe soule out wende with þulke wo&rrot;de &punctelev; and þe Aungeles aungeles fo&rrot;th hire bere
Alle þe felaweschipes of heuene &punctelev; wel glade þerewith were
he deide þre hound&rrot;et ȝer &punctelev; and in þe þreo and fourt&ydot;þe ȝere
After þat god God was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; as þe bok us deth lere
In one toumbe of Marb&rrot;e marbre he was ileid &punctelev; sw&ydot;þe faire withalle
Out of þe harde Marb&rrot;e&slong;ton &punctelev; þe o&ydot;le gan out walle
A welle of eo&ydot;le þare sp&rrot;ong out &punctelev; riȝt at is heued anon
And at is fet a welle of water &punctelev; of þe harde Marb&rrot;e&slong;ton marbreston [vv. 3178 al. om.]
Sike men þare gonnen sone &punctelev; wel þicke þudere gon
Þarof men beren wide aboute &punctelev; and ȝeot men doth also
gret botningue þar is ȝu&ydot;t &punctelev; of men þat comieth þareto
Fo&rrot; þe welle of eo&ydot;le and of watur &punctelev; ase manie men iseoth
In þe harde &slong;ton la&slong;tez ȝeot &punctelev; þare is holie bones beoth
Man&ydot; fair Miracle miracle þare[om. þare] hath of him &punctelev; sethþe he deide icome
Þei we ne mouwen nouȝt tellen alle &punctelev; we moten tellen of some.[vv. 3205 al. om.]
¶To a g&ydot;v Gyv at one t&ydot;me &punctelev; a cri&slong;tine man ȝeode
Fo&rrot;to bo&rrot;ewi gold of him &punctelev; to is muchele neode
he ne miȝte finden him nanne bo&rrot;uȝ &punctelev; ne wed nadde he non
Þane g&ydot;v Gyv to seint Nicholas churche &punctelev; he bad with him gon
Opon seint Nicholases auter he swo&rrot; &punctelev; at one certe&ydot;ne da&ydot;e
So god God him helpe and seint Nicholas &punctelev; his gold him fo&rrot;to pa&ydot;e
Þis giv Giv fo&rrot; seint Nicholas loue &punctelev; his oth nouȝt ne fo&rrot;sok
Ake seint Nicholas to bo&rrot;ewe he nam &punctelev; and þat gold him bitok
Þis luþere cri&slong;tine man &punctelev; þo it cam to is da&ydot;e
Þat gold nolde he ȝelde nouȝt &punctelev; ake þouȝte þane giv Giv bitra&ydot;e
Þe giv Giv cam and axede him &punctelev; ȝwanne he it ȝelde wolde
Þov false schrewe þe oþur seide &punctelev; ich it þe habbe iȝolde
Þe giv Giv seide na&ydot; and he ȝus &punctelev; bote al ne heold it nouȝt
Þe giv Giv let him somoni &punctelev; þat he was to court ib&rrot;ouȝt
Ake þis false cri&slong;tine man &punctelev; þouȝte op one feolle g&ydot;nne
Ane &slong;taf he nam opon is hond &punctelev; holuȝ he was withinne
Þareinne he dutte al þat gold &punctelev; þat he scholde þe giwe ȝelde
And feolliche dutte hine and fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat men ne scholden him bimelde
bifo&rrot;e þe ba&ydot;llifs hu&ydot; comen &punctelev; þe giv Giv and he boþe
he withsok þe giwes Giwes dette &punctelev; and was idon to ane oþe
Þo he scholde is oth do &punctelev; is false &slong;taf he bitok
Þe giwe and bad him ȝwitie þe ȝwile &punctelev; he leide is hond on þe bok
And seide also muche gold also ich bo&rrot;ewede &punctelev; of þe giv Giv þat here is
So helpe me cri&slong;t and seint Nicholas &punctelev; ich tok him aȝein iwis
Þis luþere man with is fals oth &punctelev; swiþe wel ileued was
And þe oþur fo&rrot; he was a giv Giv
&punctelev; noþing ileued he nas
Ȝwane þou me ha&slong;t bigiled &punctelev; with þi false cas
Ich bidde þine bo&rrot;ouȝ þat he it me ȝelde &punctelev; þe guode seint Nicholas
Þe giv Giv with wel so&rrot;ie chere &punctelev; wende him fo&rrot;th anon
And þe false man nam is &slong;taf &punctelev; and hamward bigan to gon
Also he wende bi þe weie hamward &punctelev; to slepe he hadde grete wille
Þare twei weiȝes togadere comen &punctelev; adoun he lai wel &slong;tille
As þis false man la&ydot; and slep &punctelev; a cart þare cam gon
And altob&rrot;u&ydot;sde is false bones &punctelev; þat he deide anon
Þat o ȝweol tob&rrot;ak þane false &slong;taf &punctelev; ase mani a man isaiȝ &punctelev; [Here a fol. is wanting; MS. Harl continues &punctelev; ]
[Þat gold schadde out alab&rrot;od &punctelev; & amidde þe we&ydot;e la&ydot;
¶ þe g&ydot;w G&ydot;w þo he þis iseȝ &punctelev; loude he gan to crie
& þonkede seint Nicholas &punctelev; þat schewede his tricherie
Fo&rrot; þe miracle men him radde &punctelev; cri&slong;tene fo&rrot;to beo
Certes &ydot;nelle quaþ þis oþer &punctelev; er ic mo&rrot;e iseo
Ac if god God & seint Nicholas &punctelev; wolde þis liþer manes l&ydot;f sende
Cri&slong;tene ic wolde þanne beo &punctelev; & serui hem to mi l&ydot;ues ende
¶ Fram deþe to l&ydot;ue þis false man &punctelev; þurf seint Nicholas com
Anon so þe g&ydot;w G&ydot;w þis iseȝ &punctelev; he wilnede cri&slong;tendom
& bileouede on ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; & god man euereft was
Þis me þinȝþ a fair miracle &punctelev; of seint Nicholas
her ȝe seoþ hou hit goþ bi men &punctelev; þat wiþ g&ydot;le swerieþ iwis
Þeȝ he þurf g&ydot;le swerie soþ &punctelev; iwis fo&rrot;swo&rrot;e he is
¶A god man þer was in a t&ydot;me &punctelev; þat longe was mid his w&ydot;ue
Þat no childe nemiȝte habbe &punctelev; þat euere cam to l&ydot;ue
To seint Nicholas ofte hi bede &punctelev; achild hem to sende
& bihete him if hit so were &punctelev; to him fo&rrot;to wende
¶ Seint Nicholas ihurde here bone &punctelev; fo&rrot; god he is & m&ydot;lde
hit biful þerafter sone &punctelev; þat his w&ydot;f was mid ch&ydot;lde
& b&rrot;ouȝte fo&rrot;þ afair sone &punctelev; glad þis gode man was
he let ȝarki a fair coupe &punctelev; to seint Nicholas
So faire was þe coupe of golde &punctelev; þo heo was ȝaru iwrouȝt
& þis hosebonde heo was so leof &punctelev; þat he nolde leue hire noȝt
Ac athuld hire in his owe hous &punctelev; himsilue þerof to d&rrot;inke
Anoþer to seint Nicholas &punctelev; þe goldsm&ydot;th he let biswinke
¶ Þo þe coupe was &ydot;maked &punctelev; to þe louerd seint Nicholas
he wi&slong;te hire wiþ gret d&rrot;ueri &punctelev; ac þoþer fairere was
¶ Þo his sone was wel iwoxe &punctelev; & hadde &slong;trenȝþe & miȝte
To þe pelgrimage of seint Nicholas &punctelev; þis gode man him diȝte
& nom wiþ him his leoue sone &punctelev; & þe coupen be&ydot;e
Þe fur&slong;te þat him was so leof &punctelev; to serui him bi þe we&ydot;e
Þoþer to ofri seint Nicholas &punctelev; whan hi þider come
hi greiþede hem a gode&slong; Godes name &punctelev; & þe holi wei hi nome
¶ So þat hi come in þe see &punctelev; as hi þane wei wende
After water of þe see &punctelev; þis gode man his sone sende
Fech me he seide of þe water &punctelev; in m&ydot;n owene coupe
Þat child dude his fader he&slong;te &punctelev; & to þe water gan &slong;toupe
Þe coupe ful out of his hond &punctelev; & anon to grounde sonk
Þe child ful in afterward &punctelev; & in þe water ad&rrot;onk
Gret deol makede þis gode man &punctelev; þo he seȝ þis cas
Þat he nadde bote þat o child &punctelev; & he ad&rrot;onke was
Awei he seide þis dai abide &punctelev; leoue louerd allas
wel ic wot ic haue agult &punctelev; þe louerd seint Nicholas
Þat ic b&ydot;nom him þe fur&slong;te coupe &punctelev; louerd what schal ic do
Þerfo&rrot;e ic habbe ilo&rrot;e nou mi child &punctelev; & þe coupe also
Seint Nicholas fo&rrot;ȝif hit me &punctelev; & &ydot;nelle noȝt bileue iwis
Þat &ydot;nelle siche þe &punctelev; þeȝ me beo bifalle þis
¶ Þis gode man [him] wende fo&rrot;þ &punctelev; in deol & so&rrot;i þoȝt
Er he to seint Nicholas com &punctelev; he neturnde aȝe noȝt
Þo he to þe weued com &punctelev; þat he hadde wide isoȝt
Þe coupe he offrede þerto &punctelev; þat he hadde þider ib&rrot;oȝt
þe coupe hipte anon aȝe &punctelev; he nolde a&slong;tinte þere
Ac hipte into þe flo&rrot; &punctelev; wreche as þeȝ hit were
Þis gode man hire nom vp &punctelev; & offrede hire eft þere
Eftsone heo hipte fram þe weued &punctelev; fo&rrot;þere þan heo dude ere
¶Þo was þis gode man agrise &punctelev; & þoþere aboute also
Louerd he seide seint Nicholas &punctelev; ic haue þe moche misdo
Ich wolde offri þoþer coupe &punctelev; ac &ydot;nemai þerto come
vnderfong þus if hit beo þi wille &punctelev; fo&rrot; þoþer me is b&ydot;nome
vnderfong þoþer of mi sone &punctelev; fo&rrot; þu wo&slong;t wher he is
Let mi sone to þe offri þulke &punctelev; & let me offri þis
Fo&rrot; no hope of his sones l&ydot;f &punctelev; þe gode man þis nesede
Ac fo&rrot; he scholde his soule helpe &punctelev; & þe whatlokere do what he bede
¶Mid þis wo&rrot;d þer com in &punctelev; his sone þat was ad&rrot;onke
& bar þe coupe on his hond &punctelev; þat was mid him asonke
To þe weued he ȝeode & offrede &punctelev; to seint Nicholas
wele louerd þe grete io&ydot;e &punctelev; þat of þe miracle was
Gladliche þe fader & þe sone &punctelev; here offring vp bere
& wende hom wiþ gret io&ydot;e &punctelev; & leuede þe coupen þere
& herede moche seint Nicholas &punctelev; as hi wel auȝte iwis
Meni is þe faire miracle &punctelev; þat of seint Nicholas is
¶A g&ydot;w G&ydot;w was while in a t&ydot;me &punctelev; þat ihurde meni o tale
Of þe miracles of seint Nicholas &punctelev; þat he dude so fale
So
þat þeȝ he were a g&ydot;w G&ydot;w &punctelev; vpe him his hurte he ca&slong;te
& honurede him &ydot;nouȝ &punctelev; & biþoȝte him atte la&slong;te
An &ydot;mage p&rrot;iueiliche he makede &punctelev; of seint Nicholas
& honurede hit in his hous &punctelev; þo hit ȝare was
¶ In a t&ydot;me hit biful &punctelev; þat he hadde to done
In þe contrai þeraboute &punctelev; to come aȝe wel sone
he nu&slong;te wham his god bitake &punctelev; fo&rrot;te he aȝe come
Seint Nicholas &ydot;mage he bad &punctelev; n&ydot;me þerto gode gome
Ich þe habbe he seide iloued &ydot;nouȝ &punctelev; do me som god þerfo&rrot;e
wite mi god fo&rrot;te ic come &punctelev; þat hit ne beo fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; bi seint Nicholas þat ic louie &punctelev; if hit beo awei ibo&rrot;e
whan ic come aȝe þu schalt &punctelev; so&rrot;e abigge þerfo&rrot;e
Þe g&ydot;w G&ydot;w wende fo&rrot;þ his wei &punctelev; & tok al his god to wite
Þe &ydot;mage fo&rrot;te he come aȝe &punctelev; as hit is iwrite
Siþþe hit biful þat liþere men &punctelev; & þeoues þer come[Here L. goes on again.]
And to[al. om.]b&rrot;eken þe giwes Giwes hous &punctelev; and is guod awei nome
Þo þe giv Giv cam hom aȝein &punctelev; and mi&slong;te al is gvod[o&rrot;ig. good]
gret deol he made and seo&rrot;uwe inovȝ &punctelev; and ferde ase he were wod
to þane &ydot;mage he wende anon &punctelev; ase he bi þe walle &slong;tod
Seie he seide ȝwat haue&slong;t þou ido &punctelev; þou haue&slong;t iset harm ab&rrot;od
Ich bitok þe to witene al mi guod &punctelev; þat god God lente me
hit is nouþe al ibo&rrot;e awei &punctelev; and þat ich wite þe
Ȝwan ich it bitok þe in warde &punctelev; and þou were of pou&slong;te
to witen it wel ȝif þat þou wolde&slong;t &punctelev; þarefo&rrot;e þou haue maugre[vv. 4567 al. om.]
Fo&rrot; ȝwane ich tru&slong;te so muche to þe &punctelev; and þou nolde&slong;t do mi bone
bi riȝte lawe ase ich þe bihet &punctelev; þov schalt abugge sone
Ȝwane þou ȝolde mine godhede &punctelev; so vuele atþe la&slong;te
harde scourgene he nam and &slong;tronge &punctelev; and beot þis &ydot;mage wel fa&slong;te
Þat grete peces bo&rrot;&slong;ten awei &punctelev; he ferde ase he were wod
And euere he bad þat seli treo &punctelev; b&rrot;ingue aȝen is guod
Seint Nicholas þareafterward sone &punctelev; to þe þeoues wende
Al fo&rrot;woundet and tod&rrot;awe &punctelev; ase þe giv Giv him torende
Lo he seide hov ich am fo&rrot; ov &punctelev; Iwoundet and fo&rrot;gnawe
blok and blodi ase ȝe iseoth &punctelev; and al mi bodi tod&rrot;awe
bringez aȝen ich red ov sone &punctelev; þat ȝe habbez awei[o&rrot;ig. aȝen] ibo&rrot;e
And i&slong;tole of þe giwes Giwes guode &punctelev; oþur ȝe schulle hangi þarefo&rrot;e[vv. 4669 al. om.]
Fo&rrot;soþe i segge ȝe schullen hangen &punctelev; bote ȝe it hom anon lede
Ȝe schullen some abugge with me &punctelev; ouwer foule misdede
Þeos þeoues weren so&rrot;e ofd&rrot;adde &punctelev; heo nomen heom to rede
And ladden hom aȝein þe giwes Giwes guod &punctelev; hu&ydot; ne do&rrot;&slong;ten oþur fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede[o&rrot;ig. fere]
And weren aknowe of al ho&rrot;e gult &punctelev; and þe Miracle miracle him sede
hov seint Nicholas to heom cam &punctelev; with is sidene blodrede
Þe giv Giv and þe þeues also &punctelev; to seint Nicholas bede
Þat he fo&rrot;ȝeue heom heo&rrot;e gult &punctelev; and nolden mo&rrot;e don to quede
Þe þeues bicomen trewe men &punctelev; and ne &slong;telen neuereft mo&rrot;e
And þe giv Giv him let cri&slong;tn&ydot; sone &punctelev; and tok him alto gode&slong; Godes lo&rrot;e
And euereft mo&rrot;e euerechone &punctelev; loueden seint Nicholas
Me þincheth among alle oþere &punctelev; a fair Miracle miracle þat was[vv. 4801 al. om.]
¶In anoþur time a guod man was &punctelev; þat hadde a clerk to sone
Eche ȝere he wolde fo&rrot; is loue &punctelev; aseint Nicholas dai bi wone
Of manie clerkus gret fe&slong;te holden &punctelev; and wurthschipien[al. om.] seint Nicholas also
with offringue and seruise at churche &punctelev; gret honur him do
Þe feond hadde þarto onde &punctelev; a dai he[MS. ase he] cam þere
Aseint Nicholas da&ydot; to þe ȝate &punctelev; ase þei it a beggare were
And bad fo&rrot; seint Nicholas loue &punctelev; þat man sum guod him[o&rrot;ig. heom] ȝeoue
Anon so þat child wu&slong;te him þere &punctelev; he nolde no leng bileue
Ake b&rrot;ed he nam in is hond &punctelev; þane schrewe fo&rrot;to beode
And þo þat child cam toward þe ȝate &punctelev; þe schrewe aweiward ȝeode
Þat child eode euere afterward &punctelev; to ȝiuen him of þe b&rrot;ede
Ake he ȝeode euere fo&rrot;th ase it were &punctelev; aweiward þat child to lede
And þo he cam into a derne &slong;tude &punctelev; he biturnde him ate la&slong;te
Ase it were to nime þat b&rrot;ed &punctelev; and anon he nam wel fa&slong;te
Þat child bi is seli þrote[MS. þr ote] &punctelev; and a&slong;tranglede him anon
Þat child lai þare and deide sone &punctelev; and þe schrewe awei gan gon
Þe guode man þo he mi&slong;te is child &punctelev; he souȝte it wel wide
Ake þo he fond it ligge aslawe &punctelev; wel deolfulliche he cride
Louerd he seide seint Nicholas &punctelev; ich bidde þe milce and o&rrot;e
honoured ich þe habbe mani a dai &punctelev; ant ȝeot ich hopie mo&rrot;e
And fo&rrot; anchaisun of mi sone &punctelev; þe mo&rrot;e and fo&rrot; is lo&rrot;e
Þat þou me sende&slong;t Ioie of him &punctelev; and schilde&slong;t me fram so&rrot;e
Ȝwi ȝel&slong;tov mine ȝw&ydot;le þus &punctelev; louerd ȝwi de&slong;t þou so
hov miȝtþou þus seint Nicholas &punctelev; fo&rrot; reuþe bi me do
Ȝif me gladnesse of mi child &punctelev; þat ich mote him aliue iseo
And ich him bihote to þine seruise &punctelev; and þat he schal guod man beo
Ase he was þus in is beden &punctelev; þat child aros op allone
And herede god God and seint Nicholas &punctelev; among heom euerechone
Þat him hadde lijf isent &punctelev; fo&rrot; is fader bone þer
And he tolde alhou þe deuel hadde &punctelev; him a&slong;trangled er
Fo&rrot; also muche ase he honourede so &punctelev; þane guode seint Nicholas
Þis me þinchez among alle oþere &punctelev; a fair Miracle miracle it was
Louerd
þat fo&rrot; þe loue of seint Nicholas &punctelev; mani Miracle miracle ha&slong;t ido
Þou schild us fram þe pine of helle &punctelev; and fram dedliche sunne also
